events.title: 'It's not if there will be another pandemic, but when': Dr Christian Happi
events.description: "It's not if there will be another pandemic, but when it will happen." Dr Christian Happi and his team have just won a $100 million grant that enables them to expand their vital work to try to identify threats to provide the world with an early warning system for future pandemics. His project comes as many of his colleagues are facing huge funding cuts, with money being withdrawn from global health funding. The renowned professor of molecular biology and genomics spoke to us in Perspective.
events.ticker_label: ğŸª– 'It's not if there will be another pandemic, but when': Dr Christian Happi

events.title: Australian politics live: Wong acknowledges â€˜depth of feelingâ€™ on Herzog visit but calls for would-be protesters to â€˜recall the contextâ€™
events.description: Israeli president to arrive in Australia next week. Follow todayâ€™s news live Who is Israelâ€™s president Isaac Herzog and why is his visit to Australia expected to prompt mass protests? Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Wong says she understands there are many different views held over Herzogâ€™s visit with some, including the Palestine Action Group, still planning to protest Herzogâ€™s arrival in Sydney next week. Asked whether those groups should be allowed to protest, Wong says: We are a country, a democracy where we know people have differences of views, and I do understand very keenly that people have different views about this visit. There is a depth of feeling in different communities across Australia. We see that, we feel that. What I would ask people to recall is the context and circumstances of this visit and the purpose of it, which is to honour the victims of the antisemitic terror attack. I really do understand the depth of feeling about this visit, the depth of feeling in the community about what weâ€™ve seen in Gaza, which is why weâ€™ve been so clear about working, weâ€™re pressing for peace with others in the international community for civilians to be protected and for aid to flow. We always consider legal advice in relation to our obligations. Iâ€™ve made the point. We have invited him. I have said previously that Israel will be judged by the International Court of Justice on its compliance with the Genocide Convention. And Iâ€™ve also said previously that it must accept its responsibility for the humanitarian situation in Gaza. Continue reading...
events.ticker_label: ğŸ’¥ Australian politics live: Wong acknowledges â€˜depth of feelingâ€™ on Herzog visit but calls for would-be protesters to â€˜recall the contextâ€™

events.title: The people betting on catastrophic world events â€“ podcast
events.description: Prediction markets allow you to put money on everything from the US attacking Iran to Jesus returning. Saahil Desai explains their dizzying rise In the early hours of 3 January, Donald Trump ordered a surprise attack on the Venezuelan capital, Caracas, to kidnap the countryâ€™s leader, NicolÃ¡s Maduro. Millions of Venezuelansâ€™ lives were thrown into uncertainty. Politicians at home and abroad scrambled to respond. It seemed this was something no one had seen coming. Except one person did actually predict it. In the hours before the attack, someone - and we have no way of knowing who - placed a series of bets that Donald Trump would oust Maduro on a prediction market platform, netting them nearly $500,000 when it happened. These platforms allow their users not just to bet on whoeverâ€™s going to win the Super Bowl, but also on world events. Heavily regulated under the Biden administration, these apps have enjoyed a huge boom in popularity since Trump came to power. Continue reading...

Instead, they encountered something closer to a living hell. They were denied basic human rights and forced to endure extreme hardship. events.title: U.K. police investigating Peter Mandelson over Jeffrey Epstein email leak claims
events.description: Peter Mandelson, the United Kingdom's former ambassador to Washington, is being investigated over claims he leaked sensitive government information to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: The U.K. investigates its ex-ambassador to the U.S. over alleged leaks to Epstein
events.description: The U.K. government says newly released files related to Jeffrey Epstein suggest that the former British ambassador to the U.S. may have shared market-sensitive information with Epstein.

events.title: US: Would-be Trump assassin gets life without parole
events.description: Ryan Routh, who Secret Service stopped before he could shoot at Donald Trump on the president's Florida golf course in 2024, will die in prison. He represented himself at trial and was convicted last September.

events.title: Turkey's textile industry crushed by China and Bangladesh
events.description: Asian rivals have pushed Turkey's manufacturers out of EU markets. Factories are closing and jobs are vanishing. Is there still hope the industry can survive?

events.title: Court in Hungary declares German anti-fascist Maja T. guilty
events.description: Maja T., a nonbinary anti-fascist activist from Germany, has been sentenced to eight years in prison in Budapest. The trial has been controversial and has political implications.

events.title: 2026 Winter Olympics: What you need to know
events.description: This Friday, the 25th Winter Olympics will open in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo. How big will the Games be? Will Russia be allowed to participate in the competitions â€” and what about security and doping?

events.title: Serbia: Reform denounced as a political takeover of justice
events.description: In a rushed, opaque procedure, Serbia's ruling majority has pushed through legal amendments that critics say undermine judicial independence and are designed to neutralize the prosecutors investigating organized crime.

events.title: Tiny dinosaur fossil could provide evolutionary clues: study
events.description: Scientists have said fossils of a small newly discovered dinosaur found in Spain could change ideas on the evolution of ornithopods.

events.title: Tackling forever chemicals could save money and our health
events.description: Critics say a new UK plan to tackle forever chemicals does not match proposed measures in the EU. As European governments try to deal with the growing PFAS pollution, cleaning it up could cost up to â‚¬1.7 trillion.

events.title: Moltbook: Viral site for AI agents explodes into mainstream
events.description: Can a viral site where AI assistants discuss technical workflows and the end of humanity change the way we think about AI?

events.title: Fact check: How videos are recycled for political purposes
events.description: Old images, current crises: DW shows how recycling old content works, and how you can quickly recognize disinformation and build media literacy.

events.title: Epstein emails claim Bill Gates contracted STD, had sex with Russian girls
events.description: The latest Jeffrey Epstein file dump by the US Department of Justice saw a number of high profile individuals named, one of them being Microsoft founder Bill Gates. The documents alleged new details of his ties to the sex offender, including claims Gates hid a sexually transmitted disease from his wife after contact with 'Russian girls.' Gates has denounced the emails as false and says he 'regrets' knowing Eptein. Vedika Bahl goes through what we know in Truth or Fake.

events.title: UK will release files related to Mandelson's ambassador appointment in more Epstein fallout
events.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer Wednesday said he regretted naming Peter Mandelson as US ambassador, as the UK leader was set to release documents linked to the appointment following fresh allegations about the Labour politician's close ties to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: 'Proud to speak up for them': New photography project shows young migrants' experiences
events.description: Understanding the experience of young people as they cross borders is the aim of a new project. The GRABS project, funded by the European Research Council, is documenting the lives of migrants, but instead of just talking in an interview with the youngsters, it's trying to understand their situation and hopes for the future. To do so, the team is using methods like photography exhibitions and podcasts. In Perspective, we spoke to Dr Glenda Santana de Andrade, from the GRABS team and Paris 8 University, and to one of the photographers taking part, Israel Wabikamba, as one of their exhibitions is on display in Durban, South Africa.

events.title: 'I still would like to meet Putin': Epstein's unrequited love for Russian leader
events.description: What has Vladimir Putin got to do with Jeffrey Epstein?

events.title: How Irish police tackled Dublin's drug gangs after fake SWAT team besieged hotel
events.description: A decade on from Ireland's most notorious gangland hit, Irish police say they have had "unprecedented" success in tackling Dublin's drug gangs - and ending a bitter feud that claimed at least 18 lives.

events.title: Son of former Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi shot dead
events.description: Saif al Islam Gaddafi, the son of Libya's late dictator Muammar Gaddafi, has been shot dead by gunmen who broke into his home, officials have said.

events.title: Teenage boy swims for four hours to save family swept out to sea
events.description: A 13-year-old Australian boy has described battling "massive" waves to swim around four hours to shore and raise the alarm after his family were swept out to sea.

events.title: Wave of emotion as first Gazans return to their loved ones amid devastation
events.description: First came the cars of the United Nations, then two coaches with blue paintwork. And then came a wave of emotion - proof that the heart has a power that the head can't always match.

events.title: Poland to investigate Epstein files for potential Polish victims
events.description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk says authorities will analyze Jeffrey Epstein documents to seek potential Polish victims

events.title: Hungarian court sentences German anti-fascist activist to 8 years for far-right rally assaults
events.description: A Hungarian court sentences a German anti-fascist activist to eight years in prison for assaults at a far-right rally in February 2023

events.title: Philippine lawmakers find bid to impeach Marcos to be 'insufficient in substance'
events.description: Philippine legislators have dismissed two impeachment complaints against President Ferdinand Marcos Jr_ that accused him of crimes, including involvement in largescale corruption, that were all declared â€œinsufficient in substance.â€

events.title: Serbian government official faces forgery trial over withdrawn Kushner-linked project
events.description: A Serbian government minister and three others are on trial for abuse of office and document falsification

events.title: UK will release files related to Mandelson's appointment in more Epstein fallout
events.description: The British government has agreed to release emails and documents related to Peter Mandelson's appointment as ambassador to the U.S. despite his ties to Jeffrey Epstein

events.title: European Union citizens want more unified and bold leadership, survey suggests
events.description: An official EU poll reveals that citizens across the European Union want more unified and stronger leadership for the 27-nation bloc
events.ticker_label: ğŸ’¥ European Union citizens want more unified and bold leadership, survey suggests

events.title: China's Xi and Russia's Putin reinforce ties in video call
events.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has praised growing economic ties with China during a video call with Chinese leader Xi Jinping

events.title: Kenya unveils tax breaks for EV parts and charging stations to speed up shift to electrics
events.description: Kenya is rolling out tax breaks to encourage use of electric vehicles

events.title: Italy gets creative as it works to make art accessible for blind people
events.description: Italy is making its artistic treasures more accessible to people with disabilities

events.title: UN peacekeeping patrols suspended along Lebanon-Israel Blue Line
events.description: UN peacekeepers temporarily suspended patrols and other activities along parts of the â€˜Blue Lineâ€™ in southern Lebanon after the Israeli military said it would release what it described as a non-toxic chemical substance near the frontier, the UN said on Monday.

events.title: Gaza: Limited Rafah crossing reopening sparks hope â€“ but also â€˜massive trepidationâ€™
events.description: The reopening of the Rafah crossing in the southern Gaza Strip on Monday after more than a year is being met with both optimism and fear, a senior official with the UN agency that assists the Palestinian people, UNRWA, has said.

events.title: Invisible highways: The vast network of undersea cables powering our connectivity
events.description: Every day, we send countless emails, take part in video calls, use search engines and streaming services, while seamlessly banking online.

events.title: Florida hospital worker allegedly stole wallet from 94-year-old patient, racked up $500 on credit cards
events.description: A Florida hospital worker allegedly stole a 94-year-old patient's wallet and went on $500 shopping spree at Target. Bailey Slater faces multiple charges.

events.title: Wife of Jill Biden's ex-husband described him as 'a romantic' in 2020 interview
events.description: William Stevenson and his wife Linda had spoken about their romantic relationship during an interview in 2020, five years before he allegedly murdered her.

events.title: New clues raise alarm in disappearance of Savannah Guthrieâ€™s mother and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: UK to release files related to former ambassador's Jeffrey Epstein ties
events.description: U.K. government commits to releasing files on Peter Mandelson's appointment as ambassador to the U.S. despite his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Musk calls Spanish PM a â€˜tyrantâ€™ after Spain announces sweeping social media crackdown
events.description: Spain's PM Pedro SÃ¡nchez unveiled plans to hold social media executives criminally liable, sparking Elon Musk's profane "tyrant" response on X platform.

events.title: US military shoots down Iranian drone approaching USS Abraham Lincoln in Arabian Sea, official says
events.description: The U.S. military shot down an Iranian drone after it "aggressively approached a U.S. Navy aircraft carrier with unclear intent," a CENTCOM spokesman said.

events.title: Australian teen swims 2.5 miles for hours to save family swept out to sea
events.description: Teen hero swims 2.5 miles through rough seas to save family swept away by winds off Australia. Police praised the 13-year-old boy's courage.
